issue.title: ResendWalletTransactions() sends transactions which were long ago included in the blockchain
issue.body: My bitcoin-qt from the latest master is still sending transactions to the network which were included a block in the blockchain almost a year ago.

events.body: Are you synchronized and the transactions shown confirmed?
looks like I'm going to have to issue the patch for this one myself...
Seeing #2122 ... are you talking about initial block download here?? That isn't at all clear from the above.
ResendWalletTransactions() shouldn't be called during IBD at all...
It shouldn't. Unless there is something wrong on #2259
This occurs when the node has downloaded the most recently mined block.

I can't reproduce this. Reindexing and forcing a IBD on a used wallet seems to work as expected on my tests.

@rebroad: can you explain more thoroughly how you're triggering this?

@rdponticelli I'm just running bitcoin-qt as normal. It's retransmitting two old transactions whenever it runs ResendWalletTransactions(). I see this by the fact that it shows up in debug.log, and then shortly after the connected nodes request these old transactions.
@laanwj Sorry for the delay in replying. I'm not seeing this happen any more since using newer code, so it looks like something fixed it.
@rebroad so you can close this issue?
The recent removal of vfSpent probably solved this; no longer are parent transactions of old transactions re-transmitted.
